Founded 1919. A private non-profit Institution located in New Cairo. It operates as a private educational/cultural Institute within the framework of the 1962 Egyptian-American Cultural Co-operation Agreement and in accordance with a protocol with the Government of Egypt through which the University's degrees are recognized as those awarded by the Egyptian national universities. Accredited in the United States by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education, and licensed to grant degrees and incorporated by the State of Delaware

GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: Autumn term (September to January); Spring term (February to May); Summer term (June to July)
AdmissionRequirements: Applicants must be holders of the Egyptian secondary school general certificate (Thanaweya Amma) or approved equivalent certificate
The minimum requirement for the application is an overall high school percentage of 90% in the year 2018

The final acceptance to join the university is based on achieving the highest high school scores, in addition to achieving the highest scores in the admission's exam, the English exam, and the interview
